ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections

ElementDescription: I have the right to make my own medical decisions; after all it's my life.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: Doctors aren't perfect, so it's important that I'm involved in my medical decisions.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I'd rather be given many choices about what's best for my health than to have the doctor make the decision for me.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: Participating in my medical decisions is good for my health.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I tend to get a second opinion when faced with a serious medical decision.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: Making my own medical decisions allows me to be in control of my health.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I'm foolish to trust my doctor completely.
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I make lousy decisions
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I would have less confidence in my doctor if he/she didn't tell me what to do
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: It would offend my doctor if I were to make my own decision(s)
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: I don't know enough to make my own medical decisions
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: If I make the treatment decision, it'll be my fault if it turns out to be a bad choice
Notes: 1 = Strongly disagree;2 = Disagree;3 = Neutral;4 = Agree;5 = Strongly Agree;-99 = missing

ElementDescription: Patient Attitudes and Beliefs Scale: Pro-physician score
Patient Attitudes and Beliefs Scale: Contra-physician score
Patient Attitudes and Beliefs Scale: Decisional balance score (pro minus con)
Staff code number of person completing this form
Site
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily
